sentence.Network_en: He had left the movement because it had abandoned its centrist policies.
sentence.Network_cn: 他退出了该运动，因为它放弃了温和政策。

sentence.Network_en: The Civic Movement could be the nucleus of a centrist party of the future.
sentence.Network_cn: 公民运动的成员可能会成为未来中间派政党的核心。

sentence.Network_en: Unlike Bill Clinton an instinctive centrist, Mr Obama is a progressive liberal.
sentence.Network_cn: 与天生的中间派比尔?克林顿(BillClinton)不同, 奥巴马是一个进步的自由派人士.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 一些翻译~（转的~） ... central right 中右派 centrist 中间派议员 chauvinism 沙文主义.
在谋求连任阿肯色州长失败后,他在政治上把自己重塑为中间派(centrist) 。在争取民主党总统候选人提名的竞争中,他称自己是与传统民 …
But the reality of Clintonomics was more centrist and less ambitious than promised., 但克林顿经济的现实版却没有承诺的那么大刀阔斧 , 而更趋于走中间路线.

list.abs: most centrist politicians are opportunists rather than innovators . the party's leading think-tanks are all on the right .多数中间派的政客都是投机者而非创新者，党的领导智囊都是一致的右派。
most centrist politicians are opportunists rather than innovators . the party's leading think-tanks are all on the right .多数中间派的政客都是投机者而非创新者，党的领导智囊都是一致的右派。
Jobbik and Ataka grew out of a collapse in support for centrist parties .Jobbik和Ataka是在人们对中间党派不再支持的情况下发展起来。

centrist candidate Francois Bayrou was placed third with around 18 % of the vote , followed by far-right leader Jean Marie Le Pon with a disappointing 11 % .中间派候选人佛朗科斯.贝鲁以约18%的得票率位居第三，随后是极右翼领导人吉恩.玛丽.勒庞，其得票率只有另人失望的11%。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: from French centriste, from Latin centrum (see centre)

entry.tran: (政策或政党)温和的，中间派的
entry.def: Centrist policies and parties are moderate rather than extreme.

example.ex: He had left the movement because it had abandoned its centrist policies.
example.tran: 他退出了该运动，因为它放弃了温和政策。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who takes a position in the political center
1. supporting or pursuing a course of action that is neither liberal nor conservative
